Start.text:
This program will walk you through how to help an emergency medical situation.


 Have someone call 911 now and follow the directions to the best of your ability.

IsSceneSafe.text: Is the scene safe for everyone? Clear Cause?
buttons: Scene safe for you but not for the patient

MovePT.text: Move the patient to somewhere safe for both you and the patient
buttons: Patient cannot be moved to a safe location

TestNode.text: If device has gotten reading click yes and continue for informed decision

Call911.text: Ensure 911 has been called and wait in a safe place for EMS to arrive

PTAwake.text: Is the patient awake and able to speak well? Address the patient directly

CPRPre.text:
Ask someone to look for an AED if possible. Ensure that 911 has been called. 

 Place the person on their back on a firm, flat surface

CPR.text:
Follow Video Instructions. 
 If AED is found, turn it on and follow instructions.

SternumRub.text: Ensure 911 has been called and emergency services are coming. Rub the patient's sternum.
buttons: Patient has become able to speak well

AskWitnesses.text: Apply the pulse oximeter in the case on the patients finger as shown below. If injury is not apparent, ask witnesses if anyone knows what is wrong with the patient

Trauma.text: Has patient sustained any possible neck/head/spine injury?

InLineStabilization.text: Perform the in line stabilization move as shown below

buttons: The patient is breathing but vomiting

JawThrust.text: Perform the jaw thrust move as shown below

Heimlich.text: Try to scoop out blockage if visible during jaw thrust. If not, perform the Heimlich as shown below

ApplyPO/AssessBreath.text: Apply the Pulse Oximeter in the case on the patients finger as shown below. Keep it on the patient.

EmergencyPos.text: Place the patient in the recovery position as shown below. Ensure their airway is kept clear.
buttons: Patient moved into the emergency position

NeckPulse.text: Feel for pulse in the neck as shown below as show below.

SupplementO2.text: Ensure that 911 has been called and wait for EMS to arrive. If possible, supply the patient with supplemental oxygen.

ApplyBP.text: Wrap the blood pressure monitor cuff around the bare skin of the relaxed upper arm of the patient. Use the velcro to make it moderately tight. Once on, press the blue Start/Stop button once.
buttons: Blood pressure cuff attached and blue button pressed
Blood pressure cuff unable to be attached

ReadBP.text: Wait for the reading to finish (around 30 sec). You will know the reading has finished once three 2-3 digit numbers appear on screen
buttons: Blood pressure cuff finished reading and shows three numbers
Blood pressure cuff does not show three numbers

KeepComfortable.text: Ensure 911 has been called and wait for EMS to arrive. In the mean time, keep the patient comfortable. If possible, have someone else find a person with medical experience

Glucometer.text:
1. Unplug Glucometer 
2. Insert test strip
3. Take and apply blood sample to test strip using blood lancets
4. Wait for reading and plug in Glucometer

buttons: The patient is breathing but vomiting

ApplyPO/AssessBreath2.text: Apply the pulse oximeter in the case on the patients finger as shown below

END.text:
Please ensure 911 has been called and emergency services are on the way.
If possible, have someone else find a person with medical experience
*DO NOT* turn off device until medical personnel arrive.

Shutdown.text: Are you really sure you want to turn off this device?

EmergencyPos2.text: Place the patient in the emergency position as shown below. Ensure their airway is kept clear
buttons: Patient moved into the emergency position and is breathing
Patient moved into the emergency position and is choking

HeadTiltChinLift.text: Perform the head-tilt chin-lift as shown below.
buttons: Patient appears to be having an allergic reaction

Fowler.text: Ensure 911 has been called and emergency services are coming. If possible, place the patient in the Fowler position shown below and supply them with supplemental oxygen

Choking.text: Check if the patient has debris visible in their throat. If so, attempt to remove it. Otherwise perform the Heimlich shown below.

Allergic.text: Move the patient away from potential allergens. If possible, use Epipen or supplemental oxygen. Move patient into the Fowler position shown below.

Bleeding.text: Is the patient bleeding severly from an extremity?

BrokenBones.text: Make sure EMS is on the way an stabilize the patient in a comfortable position.

BleedExtremity.text: If bleeding profusely from an extremity, grab some piece of cloth or belt which can be wrapped around the extremity above the wound. Make this as tight as possible so as to limit the loss of blood. Make sure EMS is on the way

BleedOther.text: Find some clean piece of gauze or cloth and use it to cover the wound. Apply pressure to limit the loss of blood as much as possible. Make sure EMS is on the way.

Diabetic.text: If it is suspected that the patient is currently having a diabetes related emergency, first grab the gloves and sanitizing wipes bag shown below. Put on the gloves and clean off one of the fingertips of patient using the sanitizing wipe.

GetGlucometer.text: Unplug the glucometer and turn it on by holding the butterfly button as shown below. Set it aside for now.

GetLancets.text: Grab a test strip and lancet as shown below. Remove the purple end of the lancet by twisting it off. Remove the test strip from the package by sliding it out.

GetBlood.text: Making sure to stay sanitary, hold the test strip with one hand. With the other hand, use the push lancet on the sanitized finger of the patient. Set down the lance and squeeze around the edge of the finger. A droplet of blood should form that you can collect using the end of the test strip as shown below.

PlugInSample.text: Plug the sample into the turned on glucometer as shown below.

PlugInGlucometer.text: Finally, plug the glucometer into the cable it was initially plugged into.

LowSugar.text: The patient's blood sugar appears low. If possible, provide them some sugar rich food. Otherwise, wait for EMS to arrive.

NormalSugar.text: The patient's blood sugar appears normal. Please wait for EMS to arrive.

HighSugar.text: The patient's blood sugar appears high. Keep the patient comfortable and provide water. Wait for EMS to arrive.
